title.value: A Distributed ADMM-based Deep Learning Approach for Thermal Control in Multi-Zone Buildings
title.justification: This title accurately captures the main focus of the paper, which discusses a distributed approach combining ADMM (Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers) with deep learning models for thermal control in multi-zone buildings.
title.quote: A Distributed ADMM-based Deep Learning Approach for Thermal Control in Multi-Zone Buildings

extractions.description: This paper presents a distributed algorithm that combines ADMM (Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers) and deep learning models to control the temperature setpoints in multi-zone buildings for efficient energy management, particularly during demand response events. The proposed algorithm, tested on an 18-zone building modeled in EnergyPlus, demonstrates effective power management during peak events while ensuring occupant comfort.

type.justification: The paper involves the implementation and testing of a distributed control algorithm in a simulated environment, which constitutes empirical research.
type.quote: The proposed approach is tested on an 18-zone building modeled in EnergyPlus. The algorithm successfully manages Demand Response peak events.

name.justification: The primary research field involves the application of deep learning techniques to manage energy and control thermal setpoints in multi-zone buildings.
name.quote: This research combines distributed optimization using ADMM with Deep Learning models to plan indoor temperature setpoints effectively.

name.justification: The paper discusses the integration of smart control systems to optimize energy consumption in buildings.
name.quote: This article addresses the problems faced by multizone buildings in maintaining thermal comfort while participating in Demand Response events.

name.justification: The paper leverages machine learning models, specifically deep learning, for predictive control and optimization of thermal settings.
name.quote: The RSSM allows one to plan in a stochastic environment and handle uncertainties in a robust MPC framework. The SSM can be used in computationally efficient shooting controllers.

name.justification: The research develops a distributed algorithm for temperature control using a hierarchical approach with a central coordinator and local controllers.
name.quote: The paper combines distributed optimization using ADMM with Deep Learning models to plan indoor temperature setpoints effectively.

name.justification: The RSSM is highlighted as a model used for forecasting energy consumption in buildings and planning temperature setpoints.
name.quote: Recurrent State Space Models (RSSM) also proved to be extremely accurate to model stochastic environments and are yet to be applied to building energy forecasting.

is_contributed.justification: RSSM was not introduced in this paper, it is referenced as an existing model used for planning.
is_contributed.quote: We test both RSSM and SSM to model the building’s zone.

is_executed.justification: The model was executed for simulation and testing purposes within the study.
is_executed.quote: We test both RSSM and SSM to model the building’s zone.

is_compared.justification: RSSM was compared to SSM within the study.
is_compared.quote: The two models are compared in terms of prediction accuracy to benchmark RSSM in a building environment, and in terms of control quality to assess the performance of our distributed control framework.
